title: London MP reveals 'open warfare' tearing Labour apart
text:
A London MP today revealed the bitter splits and turmoil in Labour after publicly declaring the party had 'no credible leadership.'
Credit: PA Mike Gapes, the Labour MP for Ilford South, used Twitter to attack his fellow London MP and party leader Jeremy Corbyn.
It followed an extraordinary U-turn from Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell over Labour's economic policy.
Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn alongside shadow chancellor John McDonnell Credit: PA Mr McDonnell said the party would now vote against government plans to maintain a budget surplus.
He explained the change in a meeting with Labour MPs and peers which was described by one ex-minister as a "f shambles".
There is now no Shadow Cabinet collective responsibility in our party, no clarity on economic policy and no credible leadership.
I will use my judgement and vote according to my beliefs and conscience. But there will be no blind loyalty.
